info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 18 at 12:55PM AKST until November 19 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...SNOW RETURNS TO NORTHERN HIGHWAYS WEDNESDAY...
.Tuesday night a strong low will move along the Panhandle coast carrying plentiful moisture with it. Anticipate snow to begin early Wednesday morning, with the heaviest snowfall moving through the northern Panhandle into Wednesday afternoon, bringing heavy and wet snow to the upper elevations of the Haines Highway and the Klondike Highway. Most concern for snowfall continue to be west of Haines towards Haines Customs and north of Skagway towards White Pass
Snow will continue to impact Klondike Highway Thursday. Stay tuned for additional details at weather.gov/juneau.
* WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches.
* WHERE...Haines Highway from MP20 west towards Haines Customs.
* WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM AKST Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy and wet snow is forecasted to develop Wenesday morning into the evening along the upper elevations of the Haines Highway. The heaviest snowfall is expected between 9am to 3pm with 0.5 to 0.75 inch per hour rates at times.
info.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY
